subject: Science
title: Living on the Ring of Fire
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Living on the Ring of Fire.

hook.text: 75% of the world's volcanoes and 90% of earthquakes happen along the Ring of Fire.

buildup.text: This 40,000-km horseshoe of subduction zones circles the Pacific Ocean.

discovery.text: Over 450 million people live directly on the Ring of Fire.

twist.text: Volcanic soil is incredibly fertile. People farm there because the harvests are amazing.

climax.text: The same forces that threaten lives also create the richest farmland on Earth.

punchline.text: People live on volcanoes because the soil is worth the risk.

quiz.question: Why do so many people live near active volcanoes?
